pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:0.5: 65. The training rule on married girls
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.2: the nuns were giving the full admission to married girls less than twelve years old.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.3: They were unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.4: and they were unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.5: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.6: “How can nuns give the full admission to married girls less than twelve years old?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.7: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.11: A married girl less than twelve years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; contact with horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, the burning sun, and creeping animals and insects; rude and unwelcome speech;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.12: and she’s unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.13: But a married girl who is twelve years old is able to endure these things.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.16: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:1.17.1: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a married girl who is less than twelve years old, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.5: Who is less than twelve years old:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.6: who has not reached twelve years of age.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.8: one who has gone to the place of a man is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.11: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.12: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.13: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.14: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.1.15: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.1: If the girl is less than twelve years old, but the nun perceives her as less, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.2: If the girl is less than twelve years old, but the nun is unsure of it, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.3: If the girl is less than twelve years old, but the nun perceives her as more, and she gives her the full admission, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.4: If the girl is more than twelve years old, but the nun perceives her as less, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.5: If the girl is more than twelve years old, but the nun is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.2.6: If the girl is more than twelve years old, and the nun perceives her as more, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.2: if she gives the full admission to a girl less than twelve years old, but she perceives her as more;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.3: if she gives the full admission to a girl more than twelve years old, and she perceives her as more;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc65:2.3.6: The fifth training rule is finished.
